quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and City
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, linz, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Is Geneva (Genève) located within the EU territory?

options.text: No, it is in Switzerland which is outside ot EU.
No, it is a self-governed city (like Monaco) which is outside of the EU.
Yes, it is an Italian city.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No, it is in Switzerland which is outside ot EU.

questions.question: Where is the city of Brno located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the Czech Republic

questions.question: In what country is Lviv located?
In which Central European country will you find Munich (Muenchen)?
Which European country used to have Cracow (Kraków) as its capital?
Where is Kosice (Košice)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Slovakia

questions.question: In which Baltic country will you find the city of Kaunas?
Which countrys second largest port is Turku?
In what country will you find the city of Narvik?
In which German-speaking country will you find the city of Linz?
Before the Spanish arrived, this country was home to various Pre-Inca cultures and later, to the Inca Empire. Francisco Pizarro landed on its coast in 1532.
The name of this small African country means lioness mountains. Its written history begins in 1462 when Portuguese explorers first landed there.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sierra Leone

questions.question: In what country will you find the Adriatic town of Trieste (Trst, Triest)?
Aalborg is the main city of the region of North Jutland which is located in this country.
This country won its independence from France. Its currency is Gourde (HTG) and capital - Port-au-Prince.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Titanic and Ship
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cherbourg, hill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The construction of the Titanic was fully completed on 31 March, 1912.  Titanics maiden voyage commenced from Southampton, England on this memorable day.
The Titanic broke into two sections and by 2:20 AM they had both sunk into the ocean. About two hours later, this ship arrived and began rescuing the survivors.

At 11:40 PM, the fatal iceberg was spotted by the lookouts - Fredrick Fleet and Reginald Lee, and the bridge was warned. An abrupt turn to port (left) and full speed astern were the orders of First Officer Murdoch, but the collision was still inevitable. How did the iceberg collide with Titanic?

options.text: It hit the ships right side directly
It hit the ships head directly

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It brushed its right side

questions.question: Prior to Titanics fatal incident, the distress signal SOS had never been used.
The Titanic was the second of a trio of giant liners, designed to dominate the transatlantic travel business. It was owned by the White Star Line. Where was the Titanic built?
When on 1 September, 1985 the wreck of the Titanic was discovered by a team of scientists, it became clear that the two sections had sunk one on top of the other.
On the fatal day of the disaster, the Titanic recieved many iceberg warnings. The last one was recieved at 9:40 PM from this ship.
Which country’s name is derived from silver?
The Titanic was one of the most luxurious ships for its time. It offered an on-board swimming pool, gymnasium, and a Turkish bath.  Its passengers could also enjoy a squash court.
What is the meaning of the name of China in the native language of the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Middle Kingdom

questions.question: The White Star Lines managing director, who also came up with the idea of building ship, was on-board the Titanic (this is true). However, the ships builder didnt board the ship, because he was afraid of sailing.
What is the origin of the name of Australia?

options.text: Austral parakeet, a parrot native to the continent
It refers to the multitude of stars that can be observed from there (astral land)

questions.question: After the ship departed from Southampton, it stopped at Cherbourg, France and Queenstown, Ireland, to disembark and board some additional passengers. Then, it continued its voyage with over 1,300 passengers on-board, who were segregated in this many class sections.

After it became clear that the Titanic could not stay afloat, safety measures to save the crew and the passengers were taken. At 12:40 AM the first lifeboat, boat 7, was lowered. How many of these boats did Titanic have?
Faith Hill sang the famous song My Heart Will Go On from the Soundtrack of the movie Titanic (1997).

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, patricks, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 1980s, the proud residents of this city  declared its independence from the United States and formed the Conch Republic. People on Duval Street party each night until dawn and at 201 Duval Street  you can drink to the writer Ernest Hemingway at Sloppy Joes bar. What southernmost city in the continental United States did Hemingway call The St Tropez of the Poor ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Key West

questions.question: What is the origin of the name of Tanzania?

options.text: It comes from Latin stanza, meaning poetry.
Tanzan, a Buddhist monk who was the legendary founder of the country
Land of the Proud in Swahili
Its a combination of TANganyika and ZANzibar, the two main parts of the country.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its a combination of TANganyika and ZANzibar, the two main parts of the country.

questions.question: Belarus is a country in Eastern Europe. The name relates to Russia. What is the proper translation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Russia

questions.question: Which country’s name means rich harbour?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puerto Rico

questions.question: From Antebellum mansions, to shotguns houses, to Creole houses found in the French Quarter, the architecture reflects this citys history. Marie Laveau, Jean Lafitte, Harry Connick Jr. and Ann Rice have walked the streets of The Crescent City. Andrew Jackson fought the last battle of the War of 1812 in this city two weeks after the war had ended with the signing of the Treaty of Ghent. The city is New Orleans but  by what other name is New Orleans affectionately called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Big Easy

questions.question: Which country name does NOT contain a color?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sri Lanka

questions.question: Many Caribbean nations are named after a saint. Which saint country is fictional?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint George

questions.question: This charming southern city has the second largest St. Patricks Day parade in the nation. Paula Deenes Lady and Two Sons restaurant first opened in this city. UGA, the white bulldog that is the mascot for the University of Georgia lives here, in Savanna. But Savanna has a darker and more secret side that is revealed in John Berndts best selling book about the murder of Danny Hansord. What is the name of the book that introduces Lady Chablis and John Williams to the nation?

options.text: Dark Secret:  The Murder of Danny Hansford
Voodoo and Murder in Old Savanna
Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil

questions.question: Many Central Asian countries’ names end with STAN. What does the suffix mean?

The City of Brotherly Love is seeped in American history. Visit Independence Hall to see where the Declaration of Independence was signed. You can still walk on cobblestones and see the Liberty Bell. Have a cheesesteak, it was invented in this city.  And South Street is where all the hippies meet.  What city would you be in to watch the Mummers Parade?
Which countrys name can be translated as God fights?

In this four-mile area know as the strip one can find a replica of the Statue of Liberty, gondolas floating on canals, the castles of Camelot, and a replica of the Eiffel Tower. Best of all what happens in this city stays in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Las Vegas

questions.question: Which African nation is country of the blacks?
Which country has a lion in its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sierra Leone

questions.question: Which was the first US state to declare Christmas a legal holiday?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Capital and England
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, headquarters, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The United Nations Headquarters is in London, England.
The capital of Hawaii is Honolulu.
Most natural Christmas trees are edible.
Christopher Columbus is credited with discovering America. His ship the Mayflower actually made 12 trips back and forth across the Atlantic.
Which of these was a traditional Christmas dinner in early England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pig head

questions.question: There are 7 oceans in the world.
Detroit, Michigan was founded by a man named Cadillac.
The Canadian city Winnipeg is located 250 miles north of  New York City.
The capital of California is San Francisco.
Chicago is known as the Windy City.
Who was the first United States President to decorate an official White House Christmas tree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Pierce

questions.question: People in which country used to decorate Christmas trees with artificial roses and set  them on fire?
The Mason-Dixon line runs parallel to the Mississippi River.
The song, Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas was introduced in which Broadway musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meet Me in St. Louis

questions.question: Both Frederick Cook and Robert Peary are credited with discovering the North Pole.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Letter
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, beliefs, catkin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is no U.S. state capital that starts with the letter F.
How many U.S. states that begin with the letter M, have state capitals that also start with the letter M?
It is customary in this country to put an artificial spider and a web on the Christmas tree.
When listing all the U.S. states in alphabetical order, which state capital comes first?
Which is the only state that has the word Saint (St.) in its state capital?
How many U.S. state capitals have the word city included in their name?

July 7th-14th is the time when youd better stay out of the streets in Pamplona, Spain. A herd of fighting bulls are let loose onto the streets, after a crowd of young men. A lot of injuries occur during this famous fiesta.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bull Running

questions.question: According to beliefs in Poland, swallowing a willow catkin from a branch consecrated by a priest would bring good health. When does this event take place?

This peculiar tradition takes place in Spain too. Right at the peak of the tomato season a wild tomato battle develops as people pelt each other with ripe tomatoes. Rivers of tomato sauce run down the streets.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Tomatina

questions.question: How many U.S. state capitals have two words in their name?
There is a strange tradition in this Spanish town which involves geese.  During the fiesta men try to pull the neck off a goose while repeatedly plunging into the water.
Sending these items for Christmas is considered bad manners in Japan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Christmas cards

questions.question: You wouldnt want to be a bride in this country - the honey moon lasts three months and according to custom, the bride covers all expenses.
Russians have the  strange custom of fighting these wild animals. After a hunt, the fighter combats this type of animal either with his bare hands or using a pitchfork.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A bear

questions.question: How many U.S. state capitals share the same first letter with their state?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Men and Myth
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, countrys, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of the these is a British physicist and mathematician, born on Christmas Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Isaac Newton

questions.question: At Christmas, Christians in the tropical areas of this country decorate banana or mango trees .
This countrys Christmas tree decorations traditionally include an artificial spider web.
The myth of Santa Claus was inspired by the story of which real person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Nicholas

questions.question: In what major European city was the first commercial Christmas card introduced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: London, United Kingdom

questions.question: Where does the earliest evidence of Christmas celebrations come from?
Composed in 1857 by James Pierpont, this is the original name of the popular Christmas song, Jingle Bells.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One-Horse Open Sleigh

questions.question: Russians have another strange tradition for men. They get together and prepare a bottle of vodka for every three men.  Then they drink until this happens.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A man falls

questions.question: The original versioan of the popular Christmas song, Silent night was what language?
In which of of the following countries, Christmas presents are brought by a kindly witch and not by Santa?
According to tradition, passengers of the train passing over the Jamuna river in India, should give tribute to the river by throwing this in it.
According to the myth, what do the children on Santas bad list often receive, instead of presents?

options.text: A book with proverbs and morals

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A piece of coal

questions.question: Which of the following songs is not a Christmas carol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Modest Maid

questions.question: Christmas, a Christian holiday celebrated all over the world, is known under what name in the Netherlands?
Folk hero Santa Claus is a variant of a European folk tale based on the historical figure of Saint Nicholas, who lived on the territory of what present-day country?
